intro: Cyclophorus ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's cyclophorus, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
